1 /**
  2  * @overview this library tries to be synchronous and high-level API built on top of regular RHQ remote API. Compatible with JBoss ON 3.1.2 and 3.2.0
  3  * @name RHQ API
  4  * @version 0.3
  5  * @author Libor Zoubek (lzoubek@redhat.com), Filip Brychta (fbrychta@redhat.com), John Sanda (jsanda@redhat.com)
  6  *
  7  * 
  8  * If you want to contribute this code, please note following things
  9  * 
 10  * - do not return RHQ Domain objects out of rhqapi functions, always create a wrapper object which can hold and expose RHQ Domain object
 11  * - create namespace for each valid subsystem (resources, resourceTypes) and make sure that each subsystem has find() method that follows
 12  *   same criteria/query pattern as resources.find()
 13  * - If there is an asynchronous operation/method defined by RHQ remote API, make it synchronous and implement waiting
 14  * - enable logging 
 15  *   - make rhqapi log at TRACE level on every JS function you write
 16  *   - make rhqapi log at DEBUG level in case you think it might help understand what is going on
 17  *   - make rhqapi log at INFO level in case you need to inform user about some progress/status
 18  * - think of rhqapi the way it can be consumed interactively by human (if there are wrong inputs provided and there is a way to advise correct ones, do that)
 19  * - write JSDoc with examples
 20  * - don't forget to expose your subsystem/class to commonjs (look at the end of this file)
 21  * 
 22  */
 23

 27 /**
 28  * print function that recognizes arrays or JS objects (hashes) and prints each item on new line,
 29  * it produces JSON-like output (but NOT JSON)
 30  */
 31 var p = function(object) {
 32 	println(new _common().objToString(object))
 33 };

 35 //Production steps of ECMA-262, Edition 5, 15.4.4.19
 36 //Reference: http://es5.github.com/#x15.4.4.19
 37 if (!Array.prototype.map) {
 38 	Array.prototype.map = function(callback, thisArg) {
 39 		var T, A, k;
 40 		if (this == null) {
 41 			throw new TypeError(" this is null or not defined");
 42 		}
 43 		var O = Object(this);
 44 		var len = O.length >>> 0;
 45 		if (typeof callback !== "function") {
 46 			throw new TypeError(callback + " is not a function");
 47 		}
 48 		if (thisArg) {
 49 			T = thisArg;
 50 		}
 51 		A = new Array(len);
 52 		k = 0;
 53 		while (k < len) {
 54 			var kValue, mappedValue;
 55 			if (k in O) {
 56 				kValue = O[k];
 57 				mappedValue = callback.call(T, kValue, k, O);
 58 				A[k] = mappedValue;
 59 			}
 60 			k++;
 61 		}
 62 		return A;
 63 	};
 64 }

 71 var _common = function() {
 72 	var _println = function(object) {
 73 		if (object instanceof Array) {
 74 			object.forEach(function(x){println(x);});
 75 		}
 76 		else {
 77 			println(object);
 78 		}

 80 	var _time = function() {
 81 		var now = new Date();
 82     var zeros = function(number) {if (number<10) { number = "0"+number;} return number;};
 83 		return zeros(now.getHours())+ ":"+zeros(now.getMinutes())+":"+zeros(now.getSeconds());
 84 	};

 86 	var _trace = function(message) {
 87 		if (typeof verbose == "number" && verbose>=2) {
 88 			_println(_time()+" [TRACE] "+message);

113 	// taken from CLI samples/utils.js
114 	/**
115 	 * A convenience function to convert javascript hashes into RHQ's
116 	 * configuration objects.
117 	 * <p>
118 	 * The conversion of individual keys in the hash follows these rules:
119 	 * <ol>
120 	 * <li> if a value of a key is a javascript array, it is interpreted as
121 	 * PropertyList
122 	 * <li> if a value is a hash, it is interpreted as a PropertyMap
123 	 * <li> otherwise it is interpreted as a PropertySimple
124 	 * <li> a null or undefined value is ignored
125 	 * </ol>
126 	 * <p>
127 	 * Note that the conversion isn't perfect, because the hash does not contain
128 	 * enough information to restore the names of the list members.
129 	 * <p>
130 	 * Example: <br/>
131 	 *
132 	 * <pre><code>
133 	 * {
134 	 * 	simple : "value",
135 	 * 	list : [ "value1", "value2" ],
136 	 * 	listOfMaps : [ {
137 	 * 		k1 : "value",
138 	 * 		k2 : "value"
139 	 * 	}, {
140 	 * 		k1 : "value2",
141 	 * 		k2 : "value2"
142 	 * 	} ]
143 	 * }
144 	 * </code></pre>
145 	 *
146 	 * gets converted to a configuration object: Configuration:
147 	 * <ul>
148 	 * <li> PropertySimple(name = "simple", value = "value")
149 	 * <li> PropertyList(name = "list")
150 	 * <ol>
151 	 * <li>PropertySimple(name = "list", value = "value1")
152 	 * <li>PropertySimple(name = "list", value = "value2")
153 	 * </ol>
154 	 * <li> PropertyList(name = "listOfMaps")
155 	 * <ol>
156 	 * <li> PropertyMap(name = "listOfMaps")
157 	 * <ul>
158 	 * <li>PropertySimple(name = "k1", value = "value")
159 	 * <li>PropertySimple(name = "k2", value = "value")
160 	 * </ul>
161 	 * <li> PropertyMap(name = "listOfMaps")
162 	 * <ul>
163 	 * <li>PropertySimple(name = "k1", value = "value2")
164 	 * <li>PropertySimple(name = "k2", value = "value2")
165 	 * </ul>
166 	 * </ol>
167 	 * </ul>
168 	 * Notice that the members of the list have the same name as the list itself
169 	 * which generally is not the case.
170 	 */
171 	var _asConfiguration = function(hash) {
172 
173 		config = new Configuration();
174 		if (!hash) {
175 			return config;
176 		}
177 		for(_k in hash) {
178 			if (!hash.hasOwnProperty(_k)) {
179 				continue;
180 			}
181 			value = hash[_k];
182 
183 			(function(parent, key, value) {
184 				function isArray(obj) {
185 					return typeof(obj) == 'object' && (obj instanceof Array);
186 				}
187 
188 				function isHash(obj) {
189 					return typeof(obj) == 'object' && !(obj instanceof Array);
190 				}
191 
192 				function isPrimitive(obj) {
193 					return typeof(obj) != 'object' || obj == null || (obj instanceof Boolean  || obj instanceof Number || obj instanceof String);
194 				}
195 				// this is an anonymous function, so the only way it can call
196 				// itself
197 				// is by getting its reference via argument.callee. Let's just
198 				// assign
199 				// a shorter name for it.
200 				var me = arguments.callee;
201 
202 				var prop = null;
203 
204 				if (isPrimitive(value)) {
205 					if (value==null) {
206 						prop = new PropertySimple(key, null);
207 					}
208 					else if (value instanceof Boolean) {
209 						prop = new PropertySimple(key, new java.lang.Boolean(value));
210 					}
211 					else if (value instanceof Number) {
212 						prop = new PropertySimple(key, new java.lang.Number(value));
213 					}
214 					else {
215 						prop = new PropertySimple(key, new java.lang.String(value));
216 					}
217 				} else if (isArray(value)) {
218 					prop = new PropertyList(key);
219 					for(var i = 0; i < value.length; ++i) {
220 						var v = value[i];
221 						if (v != null) {
222 							 me(prop, key, v);
223 						}
224 					}
225 				} else if (isHash(value)) {
226 					prop = new PropertyMap(key);
227 					for(var i in value) {
228 						var v = value[i];
229 						if (value != null) {
230 							 me(prop, i, v);
231 						}
232 					}
233 				}
234 				else {
235 					println("it is unkonwn");
236 					println(typeof value);
237 					println(value);
238 					return;
239 				}
240 
241 				if (parent instanceof PropertyList) {
242 					parent.add(prop);
243 				} else {
244 					parent.put(prop);
245 				}
246 			})(config, _k, value);
247 		}
248 
249 		return config;
250 	};

252 	// taken from CLI samples/utils.js
253 	/**
254 	 * Opposite of <code>asConfiguration</code>. Converts an RHQ's
255 	 * configuration object into a javascript hash.
256 	 *
257 	 * @param configuration
258 	 * @param configuration
259 	 *            definition - optional
260 	 */
261 	var _asHash = function(configuration,configDef) {
262 		ret = {};
263 		if (!configuration) {
264 			return ret;
265 		}
266 		iterator = configuration.getMap().values().iterator();
267 		while(iterator.hasNext()) {
268 			prop = iterator.next();
269 			var propDef;
270 			if (configDef) {
271 				if (configDef instanceof ConfigurationDefinition) {
272 					propDef = configDef.getPropertyDefinitions().get(prop.name);
273 				}
274 				else if (configDef instanceof PropertyDefinitionMap) {
275 					propDef = configDef.get(prop.name);
276 				}
277 			}
278 			(function(parent, prop) {
279 				function isArray(obj) {
280 					return typeof(obj) == 'object' && (obj instanceof Array);
281 				}
282 
283 				function isHash(obj) {
284 					return typeof(obj) == 'object' && !(obj instanceof Array);
285 				}
286 
287 				var me = arguments.callee;
288 
289 				var representation = null;
290 
291 				if (prop instanceof PropertySimple) {
292 					// we don't want to represent null values as string 'null'
293 					if(prop.stringValue != null){
294 						if (propDef && propDef instanceof PropertyDefinitionSimple) {
295 							// TODO implement all propertySimple types ..
296 							if (propDef.getType() == PropertySimpleType.BOOLEAN) {
297 	                            if (prop.booleanValue !=null) {
298 	                                if (prop.booleanValue == false) {
299 	                                	representation = false;
300 	                                }
301 	                                else {
302 	                                	representation = true;
303 	                                }
304 	                            }
305 	                        }
306 							else if (propDef.getType() == PropertySimpleType.DOUBLE
307 									|| propDef.getType() == PropertySimpleType.INTEGER
308 									|| propDef.getType() == PropertySimpleType.LONG
309 									|| propDef.getType() == PropertySimpleType.FLOAT
310 									) {
311 								representation = Number(prop.doubleValue);
312 							} else {
313 								representation = String(prop.stringValue);
314 							}
315 						}
316 						else {
317 							representation = String(prop.stringValue);
318 						}
319 					}
320 				} else if (prop instanceof PropertyList) {
321 					representation = [];
322 
323 					for(var i = 0; i < prop.list.size(); ++i) {
324 						var child = prop.list.get(i);
325 						me(representation, child);
326 					}
327 				} else if (prop instanceof PropertyMap) {
328 					representation = {};
329 
330 					var childIterator = prop.getMap().values().iterator();
331 					while(childIterator.hasNext()) {
332 						var child = childIterator.next();
333 
334 						me(representation, child);
335 					}
336 				}
337 
338 				if (isArray(parent)) {
339 					parent.push(representation);
340 				} else if (isHash(parent) && !prop.name.startsWith("__")) {
341 					parent[prop.name] = representation;
342 				}
343 			})(ret, prop);
344 		}
345 		(function(parent) {
346 
347 		})(configuration);
348 
349 		return ret;
350 	};
351 
352 	/**
353 	 * applies map of values to given configuration
354 	 *
355 	 * @param original -
356 	 *            Configuration instance
357 	 * @param definition -
358 	 *            ConfigurationDefintion
359 	 * @param values -
360 	 *            map of values to be applied to configuration
361 	 *
362 	 * @return original Configuration object with applied values
363 	 */
364 	var _applyConfiguration = function(original,definition,values) {
365 		values = values || {};
366 		for (var _k in values) {
367 			// we only iterrate over values
368 			if (values.hasOwnProperty(_k)) {
369 				// parent - parent configuration
370 				// definition - parent configuration definition
371 				// key - config key to be applied
372 				// value - value to be applied
373 				(function (parent,definition,key,value) {
374 					var propDef = null;
375 					var prop = null;
376 					
377 					// decide which type of property are we working with
378 					if (definition instanceof PropertyDefinitionMap) {
379 						// println("DEF is map");
380 						propDef = definition.get(key);
381 					} else if (definition instanceof PropertyDefinitionList) {
382 						// println("DEF is list");
383 						propDef = definition.getMemberDefinition();
384 					} else if (definition instanceof ConfigurationDefinition) {
385 						// println("DEF is config");
386 						propDef = definition.getPropertyDefinitions().get(key);
387 					}
388 
389 					// this handles cases when we have property map, and it's children do not have configDefinition
390 					// so there may be just key/values
391 
392 					if (propDef==null && parent instanceof PropertyMap) {
393 						propDef = new PropertyDefinitionSimple(key,"",false,PropertySimpleType.STRING);
394 					}
395 					// ignore properties which don't have property definition (this is legal state)	// ignore properties which don't have property definition (this is legal state)
396 					if (propDef==null) {
397 						_warn("Unable to get PropertyDefinition for key="+key);
398 						return;
399 					}
400 					// process all 3 possible types
401 					if (propDef instanceof PropertyDefinitionSimple) {
402 						// _trace("applyConfiguration(), creating simple property");
403 						prop = new PropertySimple(key, null);
404 
405 						if (value!=null) {
406 							if(value == 'null'){
407 								_warn("Adding property '"+ key +"' with null value as a string");
408 							}
409 							prop = new PropertySimple(key, new java.lang.String(value));
410 						}
411 					} else if (propDef instanceof PropertyDefinitionList) {
412 						// _trace("applyConfiguration(), creating list property");
413 						prop = new PropertyList(key);
414 						for(var i = 0; i < value.length; ++i) {
415 							arguments.callee(prop,propDef,"",value[i]);
416 						}
417 					} else if (propDef instanceof PropertyDefinitionMap) {
418 						// _trace("applyConfiguration(), creating map property");
419 						prop = new PropertyMap(propDef.name);
420 						for (var i in value) {
421 							if (value.hasOwnProperty(i)) {
422 								arguments.callee(prop,propDef,i,value[i]);
423 							}
424 						}
425 					}
426 					else {
427 						pretty.print(propDef);
428 						throw ("Unkonwn property definition! this is a bug, see above which property definition was passed");
429 					}
430 					// now we update our Configuration node
431 					if (parent instanceof PropertyList) {
432 						parent.add(prop);
433 					} else {
434 						parent.put(prop);
435 					}
436 				}) (original,definition,_k,values[_k]);
437 			}
438 		}
439 
440 		return original;
441 	};
442 	
443 	var _objToString = function(hash) {
444 		function isArray(obj) {
445 			return typeof (obj) == 'object' && (obj instanceof Array);
446 		}
447 		function isHash(obj) {
448 			return typeof (obj) == 'object' && !(obj instanceof Array);
449 		}
450 
451 		function isPrimitive(obj) {
452 			return typeof (obj) != 'object' || obj == null || obj instanceof Number || obj instanceof String || obj instanceof Boolean;
453 		}
454 		function isJavaObject(obj) {
455 			return typeof (obj) == 'object' && typeof (obj.getClass) != 'undefined'
456 		}
457 		if (!hash) {
458 			return hash;
459 		}
460 		// process only hashes, everything else is "just" string
461 		if (!isHash(hash)) {
462 			return String(hash);
463 		}
464 		output = "";
465 		for (_k in hash) {
466 			if (!hash.hasOwnProperty(_k)) {
467 				continue;
468 			}
469 			var valueStr = (function(key, value) {
470 
471 				var me = arguments.callee;
472 
473 				var prop = null;
474 				if (typeof value == "function") {
475 					return;
476 				}
477 				// if non-empty key was passed we are going to print this
478 				// element as key:<something>
479 				// otherwise there's no key to print
480 				var kkey = "";
481 				if (key != "") {
482 					kkey = key + ":";
483 				}
484 				if (isPrimitive(value)) {
485 					// put strings into quotes
486 					if (typeof value == "string" || value instanceof String) {
487 						prop = kkey + "\'" + value + "\'";
488 					} else {
489 						prop = kkey + value;
490 					}
491 
492 				} else if (isJavaObject(value)) {
493 					// java object - should't be here
494 					prop = kkey + String(value);
495 				} else if (isArray(value)) {
496 					// by printing array we deeper (passing empty key)
497 					prop = kkey + "[";
498 					for ( var i = 0; i < value.length; ++i) {
499 						var v = value[i];
500 						if (v != null) {
501 							var repr = me("", v)
502 							if (repr) {
503 								// only if value was printed to something
504 								prop += repr + ",";
505 							}
506 						}
507 					}
508 					// trim last ','
509 					prop = prop.substring(0, prop.length - 1) + "]"
510 				} else if (isHash(value)) {
511 					// printing hash, again we go deeper
512 					prop = kkey + "{";
513 					for ( var i in value) {
514 						var v = value[i];
515 						var repr = me(i, v)
516 						if (repr) {
517 							prop += repr + ",";
518 						}
519 					}
520 					prop = prop.substring(0, prop.length - 1) + "}"
521 				} else {
522 					// this code should not be reached
523 					println("it is unkonwn");
524 					println(typeof value);
525 					println(value);
526 					return;
527 				}
528 				return prop;
529 			})(_k, hash[_k])
530 
531 			if (valueStr) {
532 				output += valueStr + ",";
533 			}
534 		}
535 		output = output.substring(0, output.length - 1);
536 		return "{"+output+"}";
537 	}

539 	return {
540 		objToString : _objToString,
541 		arrayToSet : function(array){
542 			var hashSet = new java.util.HashSet();
543 			if(array){
544 				for(i in array){
545 					hashSet.add(array[i]);
546 				}
547 			}
548 			return hashSet;
549 		},
550 		pageListToArray : function(pageList) {
551 			var array = new Array();
552 		    var i = 0;
553 		    for(i = 0;i < pageList.size(); i++){
554 		    	array[i] = pageList.get(i);
555 		    }
556 		    return array;
557 		},
558 		/**
559 		 * @param conditionFunc -
560 		 *            predicate waits until conditionFunc does return any
561 		 *            defined value except for false
562 		 * @param funcDelay - delay (seconds) which overwrites globally defined delay
563 		 * @param funcTimeout - timeout (seconds) which overwrites globally defined timeout 
564 		 */
565 		waitFor : function(conditionFunc,funcDelay,funcTimeout) {
566 			var time = 0;
567 			
568 			var dlay = 5;
569 			if(funcDelay){
570 				dlay = funcDelay;
571 			}else if (typeof delay == "number") {
572 				dlay = delay;
573 			}
574 			
575 			var tout = 20;
576 			if(funcTimeout){
577 				tout = funcTimeout
578 			}else if (typeof timeout == "number") {
579 				tout = timeout;
580 			}
581 			
582 			_trace("common.waitFor(func,delay="+dlay+",timeout="+tout+")");
583 
584 			var result = conditionFunc();
585 			while (time<tout && !result) {
586 				_debug("Waiting "+dlay+"s");
587 				sleep(dlay * 1000);
588 				time+=dlay;
589 				result = conditionFunc();
590 			}
591 			if (time>=tout) {
592 				_debug("Timeout "+tout+"s was reached!!");
593 			}
594 			return result;
595 		},
596 		error : _error,
597 		warn : _warn,
598 		info : _info,
599 		debug : _debug,
600 		trace : _trace,
601 		configurationAsHash : _asHash,
602 		hashAsConfiguration : _asConfiguration,
603 		applyConfiguration : _applyConfiguration,
604 		/**
605 		 * generic function to create any type of criteria. This function takes
606 		 * 'criteria' object and fills it with filter parameters given in
607 		 * 'param'. For param x in params call : criteria.addFilterX() will be
608 		 * done. There's also a shortcutFunction that can handle non-standart
609 		 * calls, for example function(key,value) { if (key=="status") {return
610 		 * "addFilterInventoryStatus.InventoryStatus"+value.toUpperCase()+")"}}
611 		 * so param key 'status' is processed by that returned string and this
612 		 * string is evaluated on the 'criteria' object
613 		 *
614 		 * @param {Criteria}
615 		 *            criteria - RHQ Criteria object
616 		 * @param {Object}
617 		 *            params - hash of parameters
618 		 * @param {function}
619 		 *            shortcutFunc - function(key,value), if returns string, it
620 		 *            will be evaluated
621 		 */
622 		createCriteria : function(criteria,params,shortcutFunc) {
623 			params = params || {};
624 			if (!criteria) {
625 				throw "Criteria object must be defined!";
626 			}
627 			_trace("Creating criteria with following params: " + _objToString(params));
628 			criteria.setStrict(true);
629 			for (var _k in params) {
630 			    // use hasOwnProperty to filter out keys from the
631 				// Object.prototype
632 			    if (params.hasOwnProperty(_k)) {
633 			    	if (_k=="_opts") {
634 			    		var _opts = params[_k]
635 			    		if (_opts.hasOwnProperty("strict") && typeof(_opts["strict"]) == "boolean") {
636 			    			criteria.setStrict(_opts["strict"]);
637 			    		}
638 			    		continue;
639 			    	}
640 			    	if (shortcutFunc) {
641 				    	var shortcutExpr = shortcutFunc(_k,params[_k]);
642 				    	if (shortcutExpr) {
643 				    		// shortcut func returned something so we can eval
644 							// it and skip normal processing for this property
645 				    		eval("criteria."+shortcutExpr);
646 				    		continue;
647 				    	}
648 			    	}
649 			        var __k = _k[0].toUpperCase()+_k.substring(1);
650 			        var func = eval("criteria.addFilter"+__k);
651 			        if (typeof func !== "undefined") {
652 			        	try {
653 			        		func.call(criteria,params[_k]);
654 			        	}
655 			        	catch (e) {
656 			        		throw "You have passed wrong argument (type="+typeof(params[_k])+") to filter "+_k + " "+ e;
657 			        	}
658 			        }
659 			        else {
660 			        	var names = "";
661 			        	criteria.getClass().getMethods().forEach( function (m) {
662 			        		if (m.getName().startsWith("addFilter")) {
663 			        		 var name = m.getName().substring(9);
664 			        		 names+=name.substring(0,1).toLowerCase()+name.substring(1)+", ";
665 			        		}
666 			        	});
667 			        	throw "Parameter ["+_k+"] is not valid filter parameter, valid filter parameters are : "+names;
668 			        }
669 			    }
670 			}
671 			
672 			return criteria;
673 		}
674 	};
675 };

678 /**
679  * @namespace provides access to all available permissions
680  */
681 var permissions = (function(){
682 	// get an array of native permissions
683 	var _globalPNat = Permission.GLOBAL_ALL.toArray();
684 	var _resourcePNat = Permission.RESOURCE_ALL.toArray() ;
685 	
686 	var _allGlobalP = new Array();
687 	var _allResourceP = new Array();
688 	
689 	// fill array with javascript strings 
690 	for(i in _globalPNat){
691 		// make sure we have javascript string
692 		_allGlobalP[i] = String(_globalPNat[i].toString());
693 	}
694 	for(i in _resourcePNat){
695 		// make sure we have javascript string
696 		_allResourceP[i] = String(_resourcePNat[i].toString());
697 	}
698 	
699 	
700 	var _allP = _allGlobalP.concat(_allResourceP); 
701 
702 	return{
703 		/** 
704 		 * All available permission names
705 		 * @public
706 		 * @type String[]
707 		 * @returns Array of all permission names
708 		 */
709 		all : _allP,
710 		/** 
711 		 * All available global (global permissions do not apply to specific resources in groups) permission names
712 		 * @public
713 		 * @type String[]
714 		 */
715 		allGlobal : _allGlobalP,
716 		/** 
717 		 * All available resource (resource permissions apply only to the resources in the role's groups) permission names
718 		 * @public
719 		 * @type String[]
720 		 */
721 		allResource : _allResourceP,
722 		/** 
723 		 * Prints names and types of all permissions 
724 		 * @public
725 		 */
726 		printAllPermissions : function(){
727 			var perms = Permission.values();
728 			for(i in perms){
729 				println("Permission name: " + perms[i] + ", target: " + perms[i].getTarget());
730 			}
731 		}
732 	}
733 }) ();

738 /**
739  * @namespace provides access to roles
740  */
741 var roles = (function() {
742 	var common = new _common();
743 	
744 	// all valid accepted parameters
745 	var _validParams = ["description","name","permissions"];
746 	/** 
747 	 * Checks if given parameter is part of valid parameters, throw an error message otherwise 
748 	 * @private
749 	 * @param {string} param parameter to check
750 	 * @throws parameter is not valid
751 	 */
752 	var _checkParam = function(param){
753 		if(_validParams.indexOf(param) == -1){
754         	throw "Parameter ["+param+"] is not valid, valid are : "+_validParams.valueOf();
755 		}
756 	};
757 	/** 
758 	 * Sets up given native Role according to given parameters 
759 	 * @private
760 	 * @param {org.rhq.core.domain.authz.Role} natRole native role to set up
761 	 * @param {Object} params
762 	 * @returns {org.rhq.core.domain.authz.Role} prepared native role
763 	 * @throws some of given parameters are not valid
764 	 */
765 	var _setUpNatRole = function(natRole,params){
766 		for (var k in params) {
767 		    // use hasOwnProperty to filter out keys from the
768 			// Object.prototype
769 		    if (params.hasOwnProperty(k)) {
770 		    	_checkParam(k);
771 		        var _k = k[0].toUpperCase()+k.substring(1);
772 	        	var func = eval("natRole.set"+_k);
773 	        	if(typeof func == "undefined"){
774 		        	throw "Given parameter '"+_k+"' is not defined on org.rhq.core.domain.authz.Role object";
775 		        }
776 	        	func.call(natRole,params[k]);
777 		    }
778 		}
779 		
780 		return natRole;
781 	};
782 	
783 	var _findRoles = function(params){
784 		common.debug("Searching for roles '"+common.objToString(params) +"'");
785 		var criteria = common.createCriteria(new RoleCriteria(),params);
786 		criteria.clearPaging();
787 		var roles = RoleManager.findRolesByCriteria(criteria);
788 
789 		return common.pageListToArray(roles).map(function(x){return new Role(x);});		
790 	}
791 	
792 	var _getRole = function(roleName){
793 		common.debug("Searching for role with name '"+roleName +"'");
794 		var roles = _findRoles({name:roleName});
795 
796 		for(i in roles){
797 			if(roles[i].name == roleName){
798 				common.debug("Role " + roleName+ " found.");
799 				return roles[i];
800 			}
801 		}
802 		
803 		common.debug("Role " + roleName+ " not found.");
804 		return null;
805 	}
806 	
807 	return {
808 		/** 
809 		 * Creates a new role acorrding to given parameters.
810 		 * @public
811 		 * @param {Object} params - see roles.validParams for available params.
812 		 * @example roles.createRole({name: "boss",description:"Role with all permissions.",permissions:permissions.all });
813 		 * @returns {Role} a newly created role
814 		 */
815 		createRole : function(params){
816 			params = params || {};
817 			common.info("Creating a new role with following parameters: '"+common.objToString(params) +"'");
818 			
819 			// check permission names and prepare hash set with native permissions
820 			if(params.permissions){
821 				var permSet = new java.util.HashSet();
822 				for(i in params.permissions){
823 					try
824 					{
825 						permSet.add(Permission.valueOf(params.permissions[i]));
826 					} catch (exc) {
827 						throw "'" + params.permissions[i]+"', permission name is not correct!";
828 					}
829 				}
830 				params.permissions = permSet;
831 			}
832 			
833 			var rawRole = _setUpNatRole(new org.rhq.core.domain.authz.Role,params);
834 			var role = RoleManager.createRole(rawRole);
835 
836 			return new Role(role);
837 		},
838 		/** 
839 		 * Deletes given roles.
840 		 * @public
841 		 * @param {Array} roleNames - array with names of roles to delete
842 		 * @example roles.deleteRoles(["boss","guest"]);
843 		 */
844 		deleteRoles : function(roleNames){
845 			if(typeof roleNames == 'string'){
846 				roleNames = [roleNames]
847 			}
848 			common.info("Removing roles with following names: '"+common.objToString(roleNames) +"'");
849 			var role;
850 			for(i in roleNames){
851 				role = _getRole(roleNames[i]);
852 				if(role){
853 					RoleManager.deleteRoles([role.id]);
854 				}
855 			}
856 		},
857 		/** 
858 		 * Gets a given role. Returns found role or null.
859 		 * @public
860 		 * @function
861 		 * @param {string} roleName - name of the role
862 		 * @returns {Role} a found role or null
863 		 */
864 		getRole : _getRole,
865 		/** 
866 		 * Finds all roles according to given parameters.
867 		 * @public
868 		 * @function
869 		 * @param {Object} params -  see RoleCriteria.addFilter[param] methods for available params
870 		 * @returns  Array of found roles.
871 		 * @type Role[]
872 		 */
873 		findRoles : _findRoles,
874 		/**
875 		 * Prints all valid accepted parameters
876 		 * @public
877 		 */
878 		printValidParams : function(){
879 			println("Parameter names: " + _validParams.valueOf());
880 		}
881 	}
882 	
883 }) ();

980 	/**

982 	 * @private
983 	 * @param {string} param parameter to check
984 	 * @throws parameter is not valid
985 	 */
986 	var _checkParam = function(param){
987 		if(_validParams.indexOf(param) == -1){
988         	throw "Parameter ["+param+"] is not valid, valid are : "+_validParams.valueOf();
989 		}
990 	};
991 	/** 
992 	 * Sets up given native Subject according to given parameters 
993 	 * @private
994 	 * @param {org.rhq.core.domain.auth.Subject} subject native subject to set up
995 	 * @param {Object} params
996 	 * @returns {org.rhq.core.domain.auth.Subject} prepared native subject
997 	 * @throws some of given parameters are not valid
998 	 */
999 	var _setUpSubject = function(subject,params){
1000 		for (var k in params) {
1001 		    // use hasOwnProperty to filter out keys from the
1002 			// Object.prototype
1003 		    if (params.hasOwnProperty(k)) {
1004 		    	_checkParam(k);
1005 		        var _k = k[0].toUpperCase()+k.substring(1);
1006 		        var func = eval("subject.set"+_k);
1007 		        if(typeof func == "undefined"){
1008 		        	throw "Given parameter '"+_k+"' is not defined on Subject object";
1009 		        }
1010 		        func.call(subject,params[k]);
1011 		    }
1012 		}
1013 		
1014 		return subject;
1015 	}
1016 	var _findUsers = function(params){
1017 		common.debug("Searching for users with following params: '"+common.objToString(params) +"'");
1018 		var criteria = common.createCriteria(new SubjectCriteria(),params);
1019 		criteria.clearPaging();
1020 		var users = SubjectManager.findSubjectsByCriteria(criteria);
1021 		
1022 		return common.pageListToArray(users).map(function(x){return new User(x);});
1023 	}

1026 		common.debug("Searching for user with name: '"+userName +"'");
1027 		var users = _findUsers({name:userName});
1028 
1029 		for(i in users){
1030 			if(users[i].name == userName){
1031 				common.debug("User " + userName+ " found.");
1032 				return users[i];
1033 			}
1034 		}
1035 		
1036 		common.debug("User " + userName+ " not found.");
1037 		return null;
1038 	}
1039 	
1040 	return {
1041 		/** 
1042 		 * Creates a new user acorrding to given parameters.
1043 		 * @public
1044 		 * @param {Object} params - see users.validParams for available params.
1045 		 * @param {string} password 
1046 		 * @example users.addUser({firstName:"John",lastName:"Rambo",name:"jrambo",password:"passw",roles:["boss","admin"]);
1047 		 * @returns {User} a newly created user
1048 		 */
1049 		addUser : function(params,password){
1050 			params = params || {};
1051 			common.info("Adding following user: '"+common.objToString(params) +"'");
1052 			if(!password){
1053 				throw ("Password is expected for a new user.");
1054 			}
1055 			
1056 			var roleNames = params.roles;
1057 			// fill it with native type, given roles will be added later using RoleManager
1058 			params.roles = new java.util.HashSet();
1059 		
1060 			var rawSubject = _setUpSubject(new Subject,params);
1061 			var subject = SubjectManager.createSubject(rawSubject);
1062 			SubjectManager.createPrincipal(subject.getName(),password);
1063 			
1064 			var user = new User(subject);
1065 			if(roleNames){
1066 				user.assignRoles(roleNames);
1067 			}
1068 
1069 			return user;
1070 		},

1079 				userNames = [userNames]
1080 			}
1081 			common.info("Removing users with following names: '"+common.objToString(userNames) +"'");
1082 			
1083 			var user;
1084 			for(i in userNames){
1085 				user = _getUser(userNames[i]);
1086 				if(user){
1087 					SubjectManager.deleteSubjects([user.id]);
1088 				}
1089 			}
1090 		},
1091         /**
1092          * Finds all users according to given parameters.
1093          * @public
1094          * @function

1096          * @returns  Array of found users.
1097          * @type Users[]

1099         find : _findUsers,
1100         /**

1102 		 * @public

1104 		 * @param {Object} params -  see SubjectCriteria.addFilter[param] methods for available params
1105 		 * @returns  Array of found users.
1106 		 * @type Users[]
1107 		 */
1108 		findUsers : _findUsers,
1109 		/** 
1110 		 * Gets a given user. Returns found user or null.
1111 		 * @public
1112 		 * @function
1113 		 * @param {string} userName - name of the user
1114 		 * @returns {User} a found user or null
1115 		 */
1116 		getUser : _getUser,

1121 		 * @returns  Array of found users.

1124 		getAllUsers : function(){

1141 /**

1146  */
1147 var User = function(nativeSubject){
1148 	var common = new _common();
1149 	common.debug("Creating following abstract user: " + nativeSubject );
1150 	if (!nativeSubject) {
1151 		throw "org.rhq.core.domain.authz.Subject parameter is required";
1152 	}
1153 	
1154 	var _id = nativeSubject.getId();
1155 	var _name = nativeSubject.getName();
1156 	
1157 	/**
1158 	 * @lends User.prototype
1159 	 */

1161 		/**
1162 		 * Id of this user
1163 		 * @public
1164 		 * @field
1165 		 */
1166 		id : _id,
1167 		/**
1168 		 * Name of this user
1169 		 * @public
1170 		 * @field
1171 		 */

1174 		 * Native subject which this object abstracts.
1175 		 * @public
1176 		 * @field
1177 		 * @type org.rhq.core.domain.authz.Subject
1178 		 */
1179 		nativeObj : nativeSubject,
1180 		/**
1181 		 * Gets all roles assigned to this user.
1182 		 * @public
1183 		 * @returns  Array of found roles.
1184 		 * @type Role[]
1185 		 */

1187 			common.debug("Searching for assigned roles to user '"+_name+"'");
1188 			var natRoles = RoleManager.findSubjectAssignedRoles(_id,PageControl.getUnlimitedInstance());
1189 			
1190 			return common.pageListToArray(natRoles).map(function(x){return new Role(x);});
1191 		},

1196 		 */
1197 		assignRoles : function(roleNames){
1198 			common.info("Assigning following roles '"+ common.objToString(roleNames) +"', to user '"+_name+"'");
1199 
1200 			if(typeof roleNames == 'string'){
1201 				roleNames = [roleNames];
1202 			}
1203 			var rolesIds = new Array();
1204 			var j = 0;
1205 			var role;
1206 			for(i in roleNames){
1207 				role = roles.getRole(roleNames[i]);
1208 				if(role){
1209 					common.debug("Adding found role " + role);
1210 					rolesIds[j] = role.id;
1211 					j++;
1212 				}else{
1213 					common.info("Role " + roleNames[i]+ " not found!!");
1214 				}
1215 			}
1216 			RoleManager.addRolesToSubject(_id,rolesIds);
1217 		}
1218 	}
1219 };
1220 // resource groups

1222 /**
1223  * @namespace provides access to Resource groups
1224  */
1225 var groups = (function() {
1226 	var common = new _common();
1227 
1228 	return {
1229 		/**
1230 		 * creates a org.rhq.domain.criteria.ResourceGroupCriteria object based on
1231 		 * given params
1232 		 *
1233 		 * @param {Obejct}
1234 		 *            params - criteria params
1235 		 * @returns ResourceGroupCriteria
1236 		 * @ignore
1237 		 */
1238 		createCriteria : function(params) {
1239 			params = params || {};
1240 			common.debug("groups.createCriteria("+common.objToString(params) +")");
1241 			var criteria = common.createCriteria(new ResourceGroupCriteria(),params, function (key,value) {
1242 				if (key=="category") { return "addFilterExplicitResourceCategory(ResourceCategory."+value.toUpperCase();}
1243 			});
1244 			criteria.clearPaging();
1245 			return criteria;
1246 		},
1247 		/**
1248 		 * finds resource groups by given params
1249 		 * @param {Object} params
1250 		 * see ResourceGroupCriteria for available params
1251 		 * There are also shortcuts for ENUM parameters: - you can use
1252 		 * <ul>
1253 		 *    <li>{category:"platform"} insetead of {explicitResourceCategory:"ExplicitResourceCategory.PLATFORM"}</li>
1254 		 *  </ul>
1255 		 * @type ResGroup[]
1256 		 */
1257 		find : function(params) {
1258 			params = params || {};
1259 			common.debug("groups.find("+common.objToString(params)+")");
1260 			var criteria = groups.createCriteria(params);
1261 			var result = ResourceGroupManager.findResourceGroupsByCriteria(criteria);
1262 			common.debug("Found "+result.size()+" groups ");
1263 		    return common.pageListToArray(result).map(function(x){return new ResGroup(x);});
1264 		},
1265     /**
1266 	 * creates a new resource group. If all children are same type, COMPATIBLE
1267 	 * group is created
1268 	 *
1269 	 * @param {String} name for a new group
1270 	 * @param {Resource[]} children - array of resources that represents content of this group
1271 	 * @type ResGroup
1272 	 */
1273 		create : function(name,children) {
1274 			children = children || [];
1275 			common.info("Creating a group '" + name + "', with following children: '" + common.objToString(children) + "'");
1276 			var rg = new ResourceGroup(name);
1277 			// detect whether all resources are same type
1278 			var resType = null;
1279 			var mixed = false;
1280 			children.forEach(function(x) {
1281 				if (resType==null) {
1282 					resType = x.getProxy().resourceType;
1283 				} else if (resType.id != x.getProxy().resourceType.id){
1284 					mixed = true;
1285 				}
1286 			});
1287 
1288 			if (resType!=null && !mixed) {
1289 				common.debug("All given resources are ["+resType+"] type, creating compatible group");
1290 				rg.setResourceType(resType);
1291 			}
1292 			var group = ResourceGroupManager.createResourceGroup(rg);
1293 			ResourceGroupManager.addResourcesToGroup(group.id,children.map(function(x){return x.getId();}));
1294 			return new ResGroup(group);
1295 		}
1296 	};
1297 }) ();
1298 /**
1299  * @class
1300  * @constructor
1301  */
1302 var ResGroup = function(param) {
1303 	var common = new _common();
1304 	common.debug("new ResGroup("+param+")");
1305 	if (!param) {
1306 		throw "either number or org.rhq.core.domain.resource.ResourceGroup parameter is required";
1307 	}
1308 	var _id = param.id;
1309 	var _obj = param;
1310 	var _name = param.name;
1311 	var _getCategory = function(){
1312 		return _obj.getGroupCategory();
1313 	}
1314 	var _resources = function(params){
1315 		params = params || {};
1316 		params.explicitGroupIds = [_id];
1317 		return resources.find(params);
1318 	}
1319 	var _resourcesImpl = function(params){
1320 		params = params || {};
1321 		params.implicitGroupIds = [_id];
1322 		return resources.find(params);
1323 	}
1324 	var _waitForOperationResult = function(groupOpShedule) {
1325 		var opHistCriteria = new GroupOperationHistoryCriteria();
1326 		if (groupOpShedule)
1327 			opHistCriteria.addFilterJobId(groupOpShedule.getJobId());
1328 		var list = new java.util.ArrayList();
1329 		list.add(new java.lang.Integer(_id));
1330 		opHistCriteria.addFilterResourceGroupIds(list);
1331 		opHistCriteria.addSortStartTime(PageOrdering.DESC); // put most recent
1332 		// at top of results
1333 		opHistCriteria.clearPaging();
1334 		var pred = function() {
1335 			var histories = OperationManager
1336 					.findGroupOperationHistoriesByCriteria(opHistCriteria);
1337 			if (histories.size() > 0) {
1338 				if (histories.get(0).getStatus() != OperationRequestStatus.INPROGRESS) {
1339 					return histories.get(0);
1340 				}
1341 				common.debug("Operation in progress..");
1342 			}
1343 			;
1344 		};
1345 		common.debug("Waiting for result..");
1346 		sleep(3000); // trying to workaround
1347 						// https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=855674
1348 		var history = common.waitFor(pred);
1349 		if (!history) {
1350 			// timed out
1351 			var histories = OperationManager
1352 					.findGroupOperationHistoriesByCriteria(opHistCriteria);
1353 			if (histories.size() > 0) {
1354 				history = histories.get(0);
1355 			} else {
1356 				throw "ERROR Cannot get operation history result remote API ERROR?";
1357 			}
1358 		}
1359 		common.debug("Operation finished with status : " + history.status);
1360 		return history;
1361 	};
1362 	var _scheduleOperation = function(name,delay,repeatInterval,repeatCount,timeout,
1363 			haltOnFailure,executionOrderResourceIds,description,opParams){
1364 		delay = delay || 0;
1365 		repeatInterval = repeatInterval || 0;
1366 		repeatCount = repeatCount || 0;
1367 		timeout = timeout || 0;
1368 		haltOnFailure = haltOnFailure || true;
1369 		executionOrderResourceIds = executionOrderResourceIds || null;
1370 		description = description || null;
1371 		
1372 		common.trace("Group(" + _id + ")._scheduleOperation(name="
1373 				+ name + ", delay=" + delay + ", repeatInterval="+repeatInterval 
1374 				+ ", repeatCount=" + repeatCount 
1375 				+", timeout="+timeout
1376 				+", haltOnFailure="+haltOnFailure
1377 				+", executionOrderResourceIds="+common.objToString(executionOrderResourceIds)
1378 				+", description="+description
1379 				+", opParams="+common.objToString(opParams)+")");
1380 		
1381 		if (_getCategory() == GroupCategory.MIXED) {
1382 			throw "It's not possible to invoke operation on MIXED group!!"
1383 		}
1384 
1385 		// get resources in this group
1386 		var groupRes = _resources();
1387 		var res = groupRes[0];
1388 		// check that operation is correct and get operation configuration
1389 		var conf = res.checkOperation(name, opParams);
1390 		
1391 		var opShedule = OperationManager.scheduleGroupOperation(
1392 				_id, executionOrderResourceIds, haltOnFailure, name, common.hashAsConfiguration(conf),
1393 				delay * 1000, repeatInterval * 1000, repeatCount,timeout,description)
1394 		common.info("Group operation '" + name + "' scheduled on '" + _name
1395 				+ "'");
1396 		
1397 		return opShedule;
1398 	};
1399 	var _getMetricSchedules = function(metricName){
1400 		var criteria = common.createCriteria(new MeasurementDefinitionCriteria(),
1401 				{resourceTypeId:_resources()[0].getProxy().resourceType.id,displayName:metricName});				
1402 		var mDefs = MeasurementDefinitionManager.findMeasurementDefinitionsByCriteria(criteria);
1403 		
1404 		var index = -1
1405 		for (i=0;i<mDefs.size();i++) {
1406 			if (mDefs.get(i).displayName == metricName) {
1407 				index = i;
1408 				break;
1409 			}
1410 		}
1411 		if (index == -1) {
1412 			throw "Unable to retrieve measurement definition with following name: " + metricName;
1413 		}
1414 		var mDefId = mDefs.get(index).id;
1415 		
1416 		common.trace("Retreaving schedules for goup with id: " +_id + 
1417 				" and measurement definition id: " +mDefId);
1418 		var criteria = common.createCriteria(new MeasurementScheduleCriteria(),
1419 				{resourceGroupId:_id,definitionIds:[mDefId]});				
1420 		var schedules = MeasurementScheduleManager.findSchedulesByCriteria(criteria);
1421 		
1422 		if(schedules.size()==0){
1423 			throw "Unable to retrive schedule for this Metric!!";
1424 		}
1425 		
1426 		return schedules;
1427 	};
1428     /**
1429 	 * @lends ResGroup.prototype
1430 	 */
1431 	return {
1432 		/**
1433 		 * gets ID of this group
1434 		 * @field
1435 		 */
1436 		id : _id,
1437 		/**

1446 		 */

1452 		 */
1453 		getId : function() {return _id;},
1454 		/**
1455 		 * removes this resource group
1456 		 */
1457 		remove : function() {
1458 			common.info("Removing a group with name '" + _name + "'");
1459 			ResourceGroupManager.deleteResourceGroup(_id);
1460 		},
1461 		/**
1462 		 * get explicit resources contained in this group
1463 		 * @param params - you can filter child resources same way as in {@link resources.find()} function
1464 		 * @returns array of explicit resources
1465 		 * @type Resrouce[]
1466 		 * @function
1467 		 */
1468 		resources : _resources,
1469 		/**
1470 		 * get implicit resources contained in this group
1471 		 * @param params - you can filter child resources same way as in {@link resources.find()} function
1472 		 * @returns array of implicit resources
1473 		 * @type Resrouce[]
1474 		 * @function
1475 		 */
1476 		resourcesImpl : _resourcesImpl,
1477 		/**
1478 		 * schedules operation on this group using cron expression. In contrast to invokeOperation this is 
1479 		 * not blocking operation.
1480 		 *
1481 		 * @param {String}
1482 		 *            name of operation (required)
1483 		 *            
1484 		 * @param {String} cronExpression (required)
1485 		 * @param {Object}
1486 		 *            opParams - hashmap for operation params (Configuration) (optional)
1487 		 * @example allAgents.scheduleOperationUsingCron("executeAvailabilityScan","5 5 5 * * ?",{changesOnly:false});
1488 		 */
1489 		scheduleOperationUsingCron : function(name,cronExpression,opParams) {
1490 			common.trace("Group("+_id+").scheduleOperationUsingCron(name="+name+", cronExpression="+cronExpression+
1491 					", opParams={"+common.objToString(opParams)+"})");
1492 			if(_getCategory() == GroupCategory.MIXED ){
1493 				throw "It's not possible to invoke operation on MIXED group!!"
1494 			}
1495 			
1496 			// get resources in this group
1497 			var groupRes = _resources();
1498 			var res = groupRes[0];
1499 			// check that operation is correct and get operation configuration
1500 			var conf = res.checkOperation(name,opParams);
1501 			
1502 			var opShedule = OperationManager.scheduleGroupOperationUsingCron(_id, null, true, name, common.hashAsConfiguration(conf), 
1503 					cronExpression, 0, null)
1504 			common.info("Group operation '"+name+"' scheduled on '"+_name+"'");
1505 		},
1506 		/**
1507 		 * Invokes operation on this group and returns result of the operation.
1508 		 *
1509          * @param {Object} params - inputs for scheduling with fileds as follows:
1510 		 *  <ul>
1511          *      <li>{String} name - name of operation (required)</li>
1512          *      <li>{boolean} haltOnFailure (optional, default is true)</li>
1513          *      <li>{Array} executionOrderResources defines execution order (optional)</li>
1514          *      <li>{String} description (optional)</li>
1515          *      <li>{Object} config - hashmap for operation params (Configuration) (optional)</li>
1516 		 *  </ul>
1517          *
1518 		 * @example allAgents.invokeOperation("executeAvailabilityScan");                       
1519 		 *
1520 		 */
1521 		runOperation : function(params){
1522             params = params || {};
1523             params.haltOnFailure = params.haltOnFailure || true;
1524             params.executionOrderResources = params.executionOrderResources || [];
1525             params.description = params.description || null;
1526             params.config = params.config || null;
1527             var name,haltOnFailure,executionOrderResourceIds,description,opParams
1528 			var groupOpShedule = _scheduleOperation(params.name,0,0,0,0,params.haltOnFailure,params.executionOrderResources.map(function(r){return r.id;}),
1529 					params.description,params.config);
1530 			var result = _waitForOperationResult(groupOpShedule);
1531 			
1532 			var ret = {}
1533 			ret.status = String(result.status)
1534 			ret.error = String(result.errorMessage)
1535 			ret.nativeHistory = result;
1536 			
1537 			return ret;
1538 		},
1539 		/**
1540 		 * Schedules operation on this group. In contrast to invokeOperation this is 
1541 		 * not blocking operation.
1542 		 *
1543          *  @param {Object} params - inputs for scheduling with fileds as follows:
1544          *  <ul>
1545          *      <li>{String} name of operation (required)</li>
1546          *      <li>{Number} delay of operation in seconds (optional, 0 is default)</li>
1547          *      <li>{Number} repeatInterval of operation in seconds (optional, 0 is default)</li>
1548          *      <li>{Number} repeatCount of operations (optional, 0 is default)</li>
1549          *      <li>{Number} timeout of operation in seconds (optional, 0 is default)</li>
1550          *      <li>{boolean} haltOnFailure (optional, default is true)</li>
1551          *      <li>{Array} executionOrderResources defines execution order (optional)</li>
1552          *      <li>{String} description (optional)</li>
1553          *      <li>{Object} config - hashmap for operation params (Configuration) (optional)</li>
1554          *      <li></li>
1555          *      <li></li>
1556          *  </ul>
1557 		 * @example scheduleOperation({name:"executeAvailabilityScan",delay:10,repeatInterval:10,repeatCount:10,config:{changesOnly:false});
1558 		 *
1559 		 */
1560 		scheduleOperation : function(params){
1561             params = params || {};
1562             params.delay = params.delay || 0;
1563             params.repeatInerval = params.repeatInterval || 0;
1564             params.repeatCount = params.repeatCount || 0;
1565             params.timeout = params.timeout || 0;
1566             params.executionOrderResources = params.executionOrderResources || [];
1567             params.description = params.description || null;
1568             params.config = params.config || null;
1569 
1570 			_scheduleOperation(params.name,params.delay,params.repeatInterval,params.repeatCount,params.timeout,
1571 					params.haltOnFailure,params.executionOrderResources.map(function(r){return r.id;}),params.description,params.config);
1572 		},
1573 		/**
1574 		 * Returns Array with metric intervals of given metric for all resources in this group.
1575 		 * 
1576 		 * @param {String}
1577 		 *  		metricName 
1578 		 * 
1579 		 * @type {Array}
1580 		 * @returns Array with javascript objects (hashmap) with following keys:
1581 		 * <ul>
1582 		 * <li>id {String} - resource id</li>
1583 		 * <li>interval {Number} - metric collection interval</li>
1584 		 * <ul>
1585 		 */
1586 		getMetricIntervals : function(metricName){
1587 			// TODO - for all metric methods - create inner Metric type like its done for Resource, compatible group checks, tests
1588 			common.debug("Getting metric intervals for metric with name " + metricName);
1589 			var schedules = _getMetricSchedules(metricName);
1590 			var array = new Array();
1591 			for(var i =0;i<schedules.size();i++){
1592 				array[i] = {id:new String(schedules.get(i).getResource().getId()),
1593 						interval: new Number(schedules.get(i).getInterval())}
1594 			}
1595 			return array;
1596 		},
1597 		/**
1598 		 * Returns Array with metric statuses of given metric for all resources in this group.
1599 		 * 
1600 		 * @param {String}
1601 		 *  		metricName 
1602 		 * 
1603 		 * @type {Array}
1604 		 * @returns Array with javascript objects (hashmap) with following keys:
1605 		 * <ul>
1606 		 * <li>id {String} - resource id</li>
1607 		 * <li>isEnabled {Boolean} - true when metric is enabled</li>
1608 		 * <ul>
1609 		 */
1610 		getMetricStatuses : function(metricName){
1611 			common.debug("Getting metric statuses for metric with name " + metricName);
1612 			var schedules = _getMetricSchedules(metricName);
1613 			var array = new Array();
1614 			for(var i =0;i<schedules.size();i++){
1615 				array[i] = {id: new String(schedules.get(i).getResource().getId()),
1616 						isEnabled: schedules.get(i).isEnabled()}
1617 			}
1618 			return array;
1619 		},
1620 		/**
1621 		 * Returns true only if given metric is enabled on all resources in this group
1622 		 * 
1623 		 * @param {String}
1624 		 *            metricName 
1625 		 */
1626 		isMetricEnabled : function(metricName){
1627 			var schedules = _getMetricSchedules(metricName);
1628 			for(var i =0;i<schedules.size();i++){
1629 				if(!schedules.get(i).isEnabled()){
1630 					return false;
1631 				}
1632 			}
1633 			return true;
1634 		},
1635 		/**
1636 		 * Returns true only if given metric is disabled on all resources in this group
1637 		 * 
1638 		 * @param {String}
1639 		 *            metricName
1640 		 */
1641 		isMetricDisabled : function(metricName){
1642 			var schedules = _getMetricSchedules(metricName);
1643 			for(var i =0;i<schedules.size();i++){
1644 				if(schedules.get(i).isEnabled()){
1645 					return false;
1646 				}
1647 			}
1648 			return true;
1649 		}
1650 		
1651 	}

1706 /**
1707  * 
1708  * @namespace provides access to resource types
1709  */
1710 var resourceTypes = (function() {
1711 	var common = new _common();
1712 	return {
1713 		/**
1714 		 * @ignore
1715 		 */
1716 	    createCriteria : function(params) {
1717 			params = params || {};
1718 			common.trace("resourceTypes.createCriteria("+common.objToString(params) +")");
1719 			var criteria = common.createCriteria(new ResourceTypeCriteria(),params,function(key,value) {
1720 				if (key=="createDeletePolicy") {
1721 		    		 return "addFilterCreateDeletePolicy(CreateDeletePolicy."+value.toUpperCase()+")";
1722 		    	}
1723 		    	if (key=="category") {
1724 		    		return "addFilterCategories(ResourceCategory."+value.toUpperCase()+")";
1725 		    	}
1726 		    	if (key=="plugin") {
1727 		    		return "addFilterPluginName(\""+value+"\")";
1728 		    	}
1729 			});
1730 			// by default only 200 items are returned, this line discards it ..
1731 			// so we get unlimited list
1732 			criteria.clearPaging();
1733 			criteria.fetchResourceConfigurationDefinition(true);
1734 			criteria.fetchPluginConfigurationDefinition(true);
1735 			
1736 			return criteria;
1737 		},
1738 		/**
1739 		 * @function
1740 		 * Finds a resource type according to criteria params
1741 		 * @param params - filter params
1742 		 * * There are also shortcuts for ENUM parameters: - you can use
1743 		 * <ul>
1744 		 *    <li>{createDeletePolicy:"both"} insetead of {createDeletePolicy:"CreateDeletePolicy.BOTH"}</li>
1745 		 *    <li>{category:"platform"} instead of {category:"ResourceCategory.PLATTFORM"}</li>
1746 		 *    <li>{plugin:"Platforms"} instead of {pluginName:"Platforms"}</li>
1747 		 *  </ul>
1748 		 * @type ResourceType[]
1749 		 * @return array of resource types
1750 		 */
1751 		find : function(params) {
1752 			params = params || {};
1753 			common.trace("resourceTypes.find("+common.objToString(params)+")");
1754 			var criteria = resourceTypes.createCriteria(params);
1755 			var res = ResourceTypeManager.findResourceTypesByCriteria(criteria);
1756 			common.debug("Found "+res.size()+" resource types ");
1757 		    return common.pageListToArray(res).map(function(x){return new ResourceType(x);});			
1758 		}
1759 	}
1760 }) ();

1762 /**
1763  * @namespace provides access to metric templates
1764  */
1765 var metricsTemplates = (function() { 
1766   var common = new _common();
1767   
1768   var forEachMetricDef = function(resTypes, fn) {
1769 	  resTypes.forEach(function(rt) {
1770 		  var metricDefinitions = java.util.ArrayList(rt.obj.metricDefinitions);
1771 		    for (i = 0; i < metricDefinitions.size(); ++i) {
1772 		      var metricDef = metricDefinitions.get(i);
1773 		      fn(rt,metricDef);
1774 		    }
1775 	  });    
1776   };
1777 
1778   var fetchMetricDefs = function(resTypes) {
1779 	  resTypes = resTypes || []
1780 	  var criteria = resourceTypes.createCriteria({ids:resTypes.map(function(rt){return rt.id})});
1781 	  criteria.fetchMetricDefinitions(true);
1782 	  var types = ResourceTypeManager.findResourceTypesByCriteria(criteria);
1783 	  common.debug("Found "+types.size()+" resource types ");
1784 	  return common.pageListToArray(types).map(function(x){return new ResourceType(x);});
1785   };
1786 
1787   return {
1788     /**
1789      * @namespace metric template predicates
1790      */
1791     predicates: {
1792       /**
1793        * predicate that accepts metric definitions of CALLTIME DataType
1794        * @field
1795        */
1796       isCallTime: function(metricDef) { 
1797         return metricDef.dataType == DataType.CALLTIME;
1798       },
1799 
1800       /**
1801        * predicate that accepts metric definitions of MEASUREMENT DataType
1802        * @field
1803        */
1804       isNumeric: function(metricDef) {
1805         return metricDef.dataType == DataType.MEASUREMENT;
1806       },
1807       /**
1808        * predicate that accepts metric definitions of TRAIT DataType
1809        * @field
1810        */
1811       isTrait: function(metricDef) {
1812           return metricDef.dataType == DataType.TRAIT;
1813       }
1814     },
1815 
1816     /**
1817      * disables metrics 
1818      * @public
1819      * @param {ResourceType[]} resTypes - resource types, see {@link resourceTypes.find}
1820      * @param filter - filter function - see {@link metricsTemplates.predicates}
1821      * @example metricsTemplates.disable(resourceTypes.find({name: "server-b", plugin: "PerfTest"}), metricTemplates.predicates.isCallTime);
1822      * @example metricsTemplates.disable(resourceTypes.find());
1823      */
1824     disable: function(resTypes, filter) {
1825     	common.trace("metricsTemplates.disable(resTypes="+resTypes+",filter="+filter+")");
1826     	resTypes = fetchMetricDefs(resTypes);
1827     	if (resTypes.length == 0) {
1828     		common.error("Failed to find resource types for " + resTypes);
1829         	return;
1830       	}
1831     	var definitionIds = [];
1832       	forEachMetricDef(resTypes, function(rt,metricDef) {
1833       		if (typeof filter == "undefined" || filter(metricDef)) {
1834       			common.debug("Preparing to disable metric template " + metricDef + " for " +rt.name);
1835       			definitionIds.push(metricDef.id);
1836         	}
1837       	});
1838       	MeasurementScheduleManager.disableSchedulesForResourceType(definitionIds, true);
1839     },
1840     
1841     /**
1842      * enables metrics 
1843      * @public
1844      * @param {ResourceType[]} resTypes - resource types, see {@link resourceTypes.find}
1845      * @param filter - filter function - see {@link metricsTemplates.predicates}
1846      * @example metricsTemplates.enable(resourceTypes.find({name: "server-b", plugin: "PerfTest"}), metricTemplates.predicates.isCallTime);
1847      * @example metricsTemplates.enable(resourceTypes.find());
1848      */
1849     enable: function(resTypes, filter) {
1850     	common.trace("metricsTemplates.enable(resTypes="+resTypes+",filter="+filter+")");
1851     	resTypes = fetchMetricDefs(resTypes);
1852     	if (resTypes.length == 0) {
1853     		common.error("Failed to find resource types for " + resTypes);
1854         	return;
1855       	}
1856     	var definitionIds = [];
1857       	forEachMetricDef(resTypes, function(rt,metricDef) {
1858       		if (typeof filter == "undefined" || filter(metricDef)) {
1859       			common.debug("Preparing to enable metric template " + metricDef + " for " +rt.name);
1860       			definitionIds.push(metricDef.id);
1861         	}
1862       	});
1863       	MeasurementScheduleManager.enableSchedulesForResourceType(definitionIds, true);
1864     },
1865 
1866     /**
1867      * sets collection interval for metrics 
1868      * @public
1869      * @param {ResourceType[]} resTypes - resource types, see {@link resourceTypes.find}
1870      * @param interval - collection interval in seconds
1871      * @param filter - filter function - see {@link metricsTemplates.predicates}
1872      * @example metricsTemplates.setCollectionInterval(resourceTypes.find({name: "server-b", plugin: "PerfTest"}), 30, metricTemplates.predicates.isCallTime);
1873      */
1874     setCollectionInterval: function(resTypes, interval, filter) {
1875     	common.trace("metricsTemplates.setCollectionInterval(resTypes="+resTypes+",interval="+interval+",filter="+filter+")");
1876     	resTypes = fetchMetricDefs(resTypes);
1877     	if (resTypes.lentgh == 0) {
1878     		common.error("Failed to find resource types for " + resTypes);
1879     		return;
1880     	}
1881     	var definitionIds = [];
1882       	forEachMetricDef(resTypes, function(rt,metricDef) {
1883       		if (typeof filter == "undefined" || filter(metricDef)) {
1884           	common.debug("Setting collection interval for metric template " + metricDef + " to " + interval + "s for resource type " + rt.name);
1885           	definitionIds.push(metricDef.id);
1886       		}
1887       	});
1888       	MeasurementScheduleManager.updateSchedulesForResourceType(definitionIds, interval * 1000, true);
1889     }
1890   };
1891 })();

1894 /**
1895  * @namespace Provides access to dynamic group definitions
1896  */
1897 var dynaGroupDefinitions = (function(){
1898 	var common = new _common();
1899 	
1900 	/** 
1901 	 * Sets up given native GroupDefinition according to given parameters 
1902 	 * @private
1903 	 * @param {org.rhq.core.domain.resource.group.GroupDefinition} groupDefinition native groupDefinition to set up
1904 	 * @param {Object} params
1905 	 * @returns {org.rhq.core.domain.resource.group.GroupDefinition} prepared native groupDefinition
1906 	 * @throws some of given parameters are not valid
1907 	 */
1908 	var _setUpGroupDefinition = function(groupDefinition,params){
1909 		for (var k in params) {
1910 		    // use hasOwnProperty to filter out keys from the
1911 			// Object.prototype
1912 		    if (params.hasOwnProperty(k)) {
1913 		        var _k = k[0].toUpperCase()+k.substring(1);
1914 		        var func = eval("groupDefinition.set"+_k);
1915 		        if(typeof func == "undefined"){
1916 		        	throw "Given parameter '"+_k+"' is not defined on org.rhq.core.domain.resource.group.GroupDefinition object";
1917 		        }
1918 		        func.call(groupDefinition,params[k]);
1919 		    }
1920 		}
1921 		
1922 		return groupDefinition;
1923 	};
1924 	var _find = function(params){
1925 		params = params || {};
1926 		common.debug("Searching for dynagroup definition with params: "+common.objToString(params));
1927 		var cri = common.createCriteria(new ResourceGroupDefinitionCriteria(),params);
1928 		cri.fetchManagedResourceGroups(true);
1929 		cri.setStrict(true);
1930 		var result = GroupDefinitionManager.findGroupDefinitionsByCriteria(cri);
1931 	
1932 		return common.pageListToArray(result).map(function(x){return new DynaGroupDefinition(x);});
1933 	};
1934 	
1935 	return{
1936 		/**
1937 		 * Finds dynagroup definitions according to given parameters.
1938 		 * @function
1939 		 * @param {Object} params - see ResourceGroupDefinitionCriteria.addFilter[param] methods for available params.
1940 		 * @example dynaGroupDefinitions.find({name:"All agents",description:"All agents in inventory"});
1941 		 * @returns array of dynagroup definitions
1942 		 * @type DynaGroupDefinition[]
1943 		 */
1944 		find : _find,
1945 		/**
1946 		 * Creates a new dynagroup definition with given parameters.
1947 		 * @param {Object} params - see org.rhq.core.domain.resource.group.GroupDefinition.set[param] methods for available params.
1948 		 * @example dynaGroupDefinitions.create({name:"All agents",description:"All agents in inventory",expression:"resource.type.name=RHQ Agent"});
1949 		 * @type DynaGroupDefinition
1950 		 * @return created dynagroup definition
1951 		 */
1952 		create : function(params){
1953 			params = params || {};
1954 			common.info("Creating dynagroup definition with params: "+common.objToString(params));
1955 			var nativeGroupDef = _setUpGroupDefinition(new GroupDefinition(),params);
1956 			nativeGroupDef = GroupDefinitionManager.createGroupDefinition(nativeGroupDef);
1957 			
1958 			return new DynaGroupDefinition(nativeGroupDef);
1959 		},
1960 		/**
1961 		 * Edits existing dynagroup definition with given name using given parameters.
1962 		 * @param {String} dynagroupDefName - name of dynagroup definition to be edited
1963 		 * @param {Object} params - see org.rhq.core.domain.resource.group.GroupDefinition.set[param] methods for available params.
1964 		 * @example dynaGroupDefinitions.edit("All agents",{name:"All agents - edited",recursive:true});
1965 		 * @type DynaGroupDefinition
1966 		 * @return updated dynagroup definition or null when dynagroup definition with given name was not found 
1967 		 */
1968 		edit : function(dynagroupDefName,params){
1969 			params = params || {};
1970 			common.info("Editing dynagroup definition with name: "+dynagroupDefName+", using params: "+common.objToString(params));
1971 			var foundDynagroupDefs = _find({name:dynagroupDefName});
1972 			if(foundDynagroupDefs.length >0){
1973 				var nativeDynagroupDefOrig = foundDynagroupDefs[0].obj;
1974 				var nativeDynagroupDefEdited = _setUpGroupDefinition(nativeDynagroupDefOrig,params);
1975 				nativeDynagroupDefEdited = GroupDefinitionManager.updateGroupDefinition(nativeDynagroupDefEdited);
1976 				
1977 				return new DynaGroupDefinition(nativeDynagroupDefEdited);
1978 			}else{
1979 				common.warn("Dynagroup definition with name: "+dynagroupDefName+" was not found. Nothing to edit.");
1980 				
1981 				return null;
1982 			}
1983 		},
1984 		/**
1985 		 * Removes dynagroup definition with given name.
1986 		 * @param {String} dynagroupDefName - name of dynagroup definition to be deleted
1987 		 */
1988 		remove : function(dynagroupDefName){
1989 			common.info("Removing dynagroup definition with name: "+dynagroupDefName);
1990 			var foundDynagroupDefs = _find({name:dynagroupDefName});
1991 			if(foundDynagroupDefs.length >0){
1992 				GroupDefinitionManager.removeGroupDefinition(foundDynagroupDefs[0].id);
1993 			}else{
1994 				common.warn("Dynagroup definition with name: "+dynagroupDefName+" was not found. Nothing to delete.");
1995 			}
1996 		}
1997 	};
1998 })();

2544          * @returns BundleGroupCriteria
2545          * @ignore
2546          */
2547         createCriteria : function(params) {
2548             params = params || {};
2549             common.debug("bundleGroups.createCriteria(" + common.objToString(params) + ")");
2550             var criteria = common.createCriteria(new BundleGroupCriteria(), params);
2551             return criteria;
2552         },
2553         /**
2554          * finds bundle groups by given params
2555          * 
2556          * @param {Object}
2557          *            params see BundleGroupCriteria for available params
2558          * @type BundleGroup[]
2559          */
2560         find : function(params) {
2561             params = params || {};
2562             common.debug("bundleGroups.find(" + common.objToString(params) + ")");
2563             var criteria = bundleGroups.createCriteria(params);
2564             var result = BundleManager.findBundleGroupsByCriteria(criteria);
2565             common.debug("Found " + result.size() + " groups ");
2566             return common.pageListToArray(result).map(function(x) {
2567                 return new BundleGroup(x);
2568             });
2569         },
2570         /**
2571          * creates a new bundle group. You can pass array of Bundles to become
2572          * members of new group
2573          * 
2574          * @param {String}
2575          *            name for a new group
2576          * @param {Bundle[]}
2577          *            children - array of resources that represents content of
2578          *            this group
2579          * @type BundleGroup
2580          * @return {BundleGroup}
2581          */
2582         create : function(name, children) {
2583             children = children || [];
2584             common.info("Creating a group '" + name + "', with following children: '" + common.objToString(children) + "'");
2585             var group = BundleManager.createBundleGroup(new org.rhq.core.domain.bundle.BundleGroup(name));
2586             BundleManager.assignBundlesToBundleGroups([ group.id ], children.map(function(x) {
2587                 return x.getId();
2588             }));
2589             return new BundleGroup(group);
2590         }
2591     };

2695   return {
2696 		/**
2697 		 * creates BundleCriteria object based on given params
2698 		 *
2699 		 * @param {Object} params - filter parameters
2700 		 * @ignore
2701 		 */
2702 	  	createCriteria : function(params) {
2703 			params = params || {};
2704 			common.trace("bundles.createCriteria("+common.objToString(params) +")");
2705 			var criteria = common.createCriteria(new BundleCriteria(),params);
2706 			return criteria;
2707 		},
2708 		/**
2709 		 * finds bundles based on query parameters
2710 		 *
2711 		 * @param {Object} params - hash of query params
2712 		 * See BundleCriteria class for available params
2713 		 * @type Bundle[]
2714 		 * @function
2715 	*/
2716     find : _find,
2717     /**
2718      * creates a bundle (a wrapper method above createFromDistFile)
2719      * @see bundles#createFromDistFile 
2720      * @param {Object} params 
2721      * If URL it must be reachable by RHQ server
2722      * @type Bundle
2723      */
2724     create : function(params) {
2725         params = params || {}
2726         params.username = params.username || null;
2727         params.password = params.password || null;
2728         params.groups = params.groups || null;
2729         return bundles.createFromDistFile(params.dist,params.username,params.password,params.groups);
2730     },
2731 		/**
2732 		 * creates a bundle (deprecated)
2733 		 *
2734 		 * @param {String} dist - path to bundle distribution ZIP file or URL.
2735 		 * @param {String} username - basic HTTP auth username (use when 'dist' is URL) 
2736 		 * @param {String} password - basic HTTP auth password (use when 'dist' is URL)
2737 		 * @param {BundleGroup[]} groups - array of bundle groups to assign into
2738 		 * If URL it must be reachable by RHQ server
2739 		 * @type Bundle
2740 		 */
2741     createFromDistFile : function(dist,username,password,groups) {
2742     	common.trace("bundles.createFromDistFile('"+dist+"','"+username+"','"+password+"','"+groups+"')");
2743     	if (dist==null) {
2744     		throw "parameter dist must not be null"
2745     	}
2746     	groups = groups || null;
2747     	if (groups!=null) {
2748     	    groups = groups.map(function(g){return g.id;})
2749     	}
2750     	var groupsSupported = typeof BundleManager.createInitialBundleVersionViaURL !== "undefined" && groups != null;
2751     	if (groups!=null && groups.length>0 && !groupsSupported) {
2752     	    common.error('Bundle groups are not supported on this version of RHQ, groups parameter is ignored');
2753     	}
2754     	if (dist.indexOf("http")==0) {
2755     		common.debug("Getting bundle file from URL: "+dist);
2756     		username = username || null;
2757     		password =  password || null;
2758     		if (username!=null && password!=null) {
2759     		    if (groupsSupported) {
2760     		        var version = BundleManager.createInitialBundleVersionViaURL(groups,dist,username,password);
2761     		    }
2762     		    else {
2763     		        var version = BundleManager.createBundleVersionViaURL(dist,username,password);
2764     		    }
2765     		    return new Bundle(version.bundle);	
2766     		}
2767     		if (groupsSupported) {
2768     		    var version = BundleManager.createBundleVersionViaURL(groups,dist);
2769     		}
2770     		else {
2771     		    var version = BundleManager.createBundleVersionViaURL(dist);
2772     		}
2773 		    return new Bundle(version.bundle);
2774     	}
2775     	else {
2776 			var file = new java.io.File(dist);
2777 			if (!file.exists()) {
2778 				throw "file parameter ["+file+"] does not exist!";
2779 			}
2780 			if (typeof scriptUtil.uploadContent !== "undefined") {
2781 			    // since JON 3.2 we can stream our content to server
2782 			    var handle = scriptUtil.uploadContent(file);
2783 			    if (groupsSupported) {
2784 	                var version = BundleManager.createInitialBundleVersionViaContentHandle(groups,handle);
2785 			    }
2786 			    else {
2787 			        var version = BundleManager.createBundleVersionViaContentHandle(handle);
2788 			    }
2789 			    return new Bundle(version.bundle);
2790 			}
2791 			else {
2792 			    // keep this to stay compatible with < JON 3.2
2793 			    common.debug("Getting bundle file from disk: '"+dist+"'");
2794     		    var inputStream = new java.io.FileInputStream(file);
2795     		    var fileLength = file.length();
2796     		    var fileBytes = java.lang.reflect.Array.newInstance(java.lang.Byte.TYPE, fileLength);
2797     		    for (var numRead=0, offset=0; ((numRead >= 0) && (offset < fileBytes.length)); offset += numRead ) {
2798     			    numRead = inputStream.read(fileBytes, offset, fileBytes.length - offset);
2799     		    }
2800     		    if (groupsSupported) {
2801     		        var version = BundleManager.createInitialBundleVersionViaByteArray(groups,fileBytes);
2802     		    }
2803     		    else {
2804     		        var version = BundleManager.createBundleVersionViaByteArray(fileBytes);
2805     		    }
2806     		    return new Bundle(version.bundle);
2807 			}
2808     	}
2809 	}
2810 	};

2870 			        		return result;

2990 		var result = BundleManager.findBundleVersionsByCriteria(criteria);
